get.description:
This endpoint is available only in Cloud accounts that support Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic regions. Additionally, It is not applicable to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Returns information about the IP reservations created for Database Cloud Service in the given identity domain. Both used and unused IP reservations are returned.

Use the optional ?networkType query parameter to get details of all the IP reservations or only those that can be assigned to instances associated with IP networks.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description:
Identity domain ID for the Database Cloud Service account:
 

  • For a Cloud account with Identity Cloud Service: the identity service ID, which has the form idcs-letters-and-numbers. You can find this ID in the Identity Service Id field on the Overview tab of the Service Details page for Database Cloud Service in My Services.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

parameters.name: networkType
parameters.description:
Allowed values (case-sensitive):
  • ALL: Get details of all the IP reservations.
  • IPNetwork: Get details of only those IP reservations that can be assigned to instances attached to IP networks.
If you omit this parameter, details about IP reservations that can be assigned to the shared network are returned.

parameters.description: Base64 encoding of the user name and password of the user making the request. For more information, see Security, Authentication and Authorization.

post.description:
This endpoint is available only in Cloud accounts that support Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic regions. Additionally, It is not applicable to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure.

Creates an IP reservation for Database Cloud Service.

Only one IP reservation can be created at a time. If a create activity is already in progress, you cannot initiate another create request.

get.description:
Returns health monitoring data for the specified Oracle Database Cloud Service instance.

For Single Instance Database Service instance, the following health metrics are provided:

  • last_logon_time - Number of days since last logon.
  • user_tablespace_usage - Max Percentage for a User Tablespace Used.
  • active_sessions - Active number of sessions.
Note: Health monitoring metrics are updated on an hourly basis. As a result, the metrics might be slightly out-of-date until the next hourly refresh.

In the event you encounter a status 500 error when attempting to retrieve data for your service instance, append the ?format=v4 query parameter and try again.

parameters.name: identityDomainId
parameters.description:
Identity domain ID for the Database Cloud Service account:
 

  • For a Cloud account with Identity Cloud Service: the identity service ID, which has the form idcs-letters-and-numbers. You can find this ID in the Identity Service Id field on the Overview tab of the Service Details page for Database Cloud Service in My Services.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

parameters.name: serviceId
parameters.description: Name of the Database Cloud Service instance.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description:
Append ?format=v4 to the end of the resource path to return basic health data in situations where errors in the monitoring would have caused a status 500 to be returned.

Note: The structure of the output when using the query parameter is not the same as the output without the parameter, but the healthcheck and metrics information is the same.

post.description:
Creates a Database Cloud Service instance.

Using this endpoint you can create a Database Cloud Service instance hosting one of the following types of database:

  • A single-instance database

  • Two single-instance databases, one acting as the primary database and one acting as the standby database in an Oracle Data Guard configuration

  • A two-node clustered database using Oracle Real Application Clusters (RAC) technology; two compute nodes each host an Oracle Database instance, and the two instances access the same shared database data store

  • Two two-node Oracle RAC databases, one acting as the primary database and one acting as the standby database in an Oracle Data Guard configuration

  • A single-instance database acting as the standby database in an Oracle Data Guard configuration. The primary database is on your own system

Additionally, if you create a single-instance database, you can create it as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance or have its database loaded from the cloud backup of another database (often called "instantiate from backup").

post.summary: Change Roles in a Data Guard Configuration
post.description:
Change the roles of the primary and standby databases on the two nodes of a Database Cloud Service instance hosting an Oracle Data Guard configuration. You can make three role changes:

  • Switchover: Switches the roles of the primary database and the standby database. There is no data loss during a switchover. After a switchover, each database continues to participate in the Oracle Data Guard configuration in its new role.

  • Failover: Causes the standby database to take over as the primary database. The primary database is no longer considered a part of the Data Guard configuration.

  • Reinstate: Used after a failover to reinstate the previous primary database as part of the Data Guard configuration, giving it the standby role.

put.summary: Replace an Existing Instance's Database Using a Cloud Backup
put.description:
Replace the database in an existing Database Cloud Service instance hosting a single-instance database using a backup of another database. The backup must be have been created by Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service and stored in an Oracle Storage Cloud Service container. Additionally, the database contained by the cloud backup must meet certain requirements:

  • It must be at version 11.2.0.4.0 or version 12.1.0.2.0 with the latest PSU (patch set update) applied.

  • If it is an Oracle 12c database, it must be multitenant (CDB). Database Cloud Service does not support non-CDB Oracle 12c databases.

  • It must use File System or ASM as its storage method for data files.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

parameters.name: walletArchiveFile
parameters.description: Zip file containing the contents of the source database's Transparent Database Encryption (TDE) wallet directory.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description:
String containing a JSON object with the following parameters.
 
  • adminPassword: string
    The password to use for the Oracle Database SYS and SYSTEM users in the newly replaced database.
     
  • ibkupBackupTAG: string
    Backup tag of the specific backup to use to replace the existing database. This parameter is valid only if ibkupOnPremise is set to no. If no value is specified, the latest backup is used.
     
  • ibkupCloudStorageContainer: string
    Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the existing cloud backup is stored. This parameter is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.
     
  • ibkupCloudStoragePassword: string
    Password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in ibkupCloudStorageUser. This parameter is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.
     
  • ibkupCloudStorageUser: string
    User name of an Oracle Cloud user who has read access to the container specified in ibkupCloudStorageContainer. This parameter is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.
     
  • ibkupDatabaseID: string
    Database id of the database from which the existing cloud backup was created. This parameter is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.
     
  • ibkupDecryptionKey: string
    Password used to create the existing, password-encrypted cloud backup. This password is used to decrypt the backup. Specify either this parameter or the walletArchiveFile form parameter. This parameter (or the walletArchiveFile form parameter) is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.
     
  • ibkupOnPremise: boolean
    Specify if the existing cloud backup being used to replace the database is from an on-premises database or another Database Cloud Service instance. Valid values are true for an on-premises database and false for a Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is true.
     
  • ibkupServiceID: string
    Oracle Database Cloud Service instance name from which the database of new Oracle Database Cloud Service instance should be created. This parameter is required if ibkupOnPremise is set to no.

Location.description: A REST URI you can use to check the progress and completion of the replace database operation.

put.description:
Performs a precheck to identity potential issues that might prevent the specified patch from being successfully applied to the service instance; it does not actually apply the patch. Specifically, the patching precheck reports on the following conditions:
  • Disk space shortage
  • Database connectivity failure
  • Compute-node access failure
  • Storage access failure
  • Conflicts with other applied patches

Prechecks do not check whether another administration task that would prevent patching is in progress; for example: backup, recovery, or scaling.

ruleType.description: The type of the rule; one of: DEFAULT, SYSTEM or USER.

source.description: IP addresses and subnets from which traffic is allowed.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

destination.description: The destination to which traffic is allowed. Specify the value "DB_1".

ports.description: The network port or ports to allow traffic on. Specify a single port or a port range. For example, 8989 or 7000-8000.

source.description:
The IP addresses and subnets from which traffic is allowed. Valid values include:
  • DB_1 for any other cloud service instance in the Database Cloud Service instance's ora_db security list.
  • PUBLIC-INTERNET for any host on the Internet
  • A single IP address or a comma-separated list of subnets (in CIDR format) or IPv4 addresses

status.description: Status of the rule. Specify whether the status should be enabled or disabled. Specify either disabled or enabled.

operation.description: Type of operation to perform on the access rule. Valid values are: update (to disable or enable a rule) and delete (to delete a rule).

status.description: State of the access rule to update to. This attribute is required only when you disable or enable a rule. Valid value is disabled or enabled.

ruleType.description: The type of the rule; one of: DEFAULT, SYSTEM or USER.

source.description: IP addresses and subnets from which traffic is allowed.

clonedServicesSize.description: Number of service instances created from the snapshot.

creationTime.description: The date-and-time stamp when the snapshot was created.

clonedServiceCreationTime.description: The date-and-time stamp when the cloned service instance was created.

clonedServiceName.description: Name of the cloned service instance.

ipReservations.title: ipReservations Array
ipReservations.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each IP reservation.

activities.title: activities Array
activities.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each ongoing or failed activity log entry related to IP reservations.

creationTime.description: Date and time the IP reservatione was created.

hostName.description: Name of the compute node using the IP reservation. This parameter is returned only when the IP reservation is in use.

identityDomain.description: The identity domain ID of the IP reservation.

ipAddress.description: The public IP address for the IP reservation.

networkType.description: Indicates whether the IP reservation is intended for instances attached to IP networks or the shared network.

serviceEntitlementId.description: The service entitlement Id of Database Cloud Service within the Cloud account.

serviceName.description: Name of the Database Cloud Service instance where the named IP reservation is used. This parameter is returned only when the IP reservation is in use.

status.description: Status of the IP reservation. Valid values: INITIALIZING, UNUSED, USED.

activity.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each item of an ongoing or failed activity log entry related to IP reservations.

errors.description: Error encountered for an ongoing or failed activity.

message.description: Message of an ongoing or failed activity.

ipResName.description: Name of the IP reservation to create.

region.description: Name of the region to create the IP reservation in.

networkType.description:
Indicates whether the IP reservation is for instances attached to IP networks or the shared network.
  • If you intend to assign this reservation to an instance attached to an IP network, then specify IPNetwork.
  • If you intend to use this reservation for an instance attached to the shared network, then omit this parameter.

jobId.description: Job ID of the creation operation.

ipResName.description: Name of the unused IP reservation to be deleted.

jobId.description: Job ID of the deletion operation.

identity_domain.description: Identity domain ID for the Oracle Database Cloud Service account.

service_components.description: Groups the health details for Oracle Database Cloud Service components.

service_name.description: Name of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance.

status.description: Status of the instance. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

status_time.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

component.description: Component for which health data is recorded. Component is DB for Database Cloud Service instance.

health_data.description: Groups the runtime metrics for the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance component.

vms.description: Groups the health details of VMs associated with an Oracle Database Cloud Service component.

displayName.description: Display name for the health monitoring runtime metric.

name.description: Name of the health monitoring runtime metric.

unit.description: Unit measurement of the metric. For example, MB and ms.

value.description: Value of the health monitoring data.

servers.description: Groups the health details of servers running on a VM.

summary.description: Groups the health summary for a VM.

status.description: Status of the VM. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

status_time.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

sub_status.description: Status of a subcomponent, if applicable.

health_data.description: Groups the health details for the server.

summary.description: Groups the health status summary for the server.

status.description: Status of the server. Valid values are UP, DOWN, or ERROR (indicating a system error was encountered during health check).

status_time.description: Time at which the status was recorded (UTC).

serviceName.description:
Name of Database Cloud Service instance. The service name:
  • Must not exceed 50 characters.
  • Must start with a letter.
  • Must contain only letters, numbers, or hyphens.
  • Must not contain any other special characters.
  • Must be unique within the identity domain.

description.description: Free-form text that provides additional information about the service instance.

shape.description:
Desired compute shape. A shape defines a number of Oracle Compute Units (OCPUs) and an amount of processor RAM. The valid shapes you can choose from depend on which infrastructure you are using for the instance:
 

  • For instances on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure:

    View a list of currently available shapes by going to the Pricing page for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute on cloud.oracle.com. The "BM.Standard" shapes in the Compute - Bare Metal Instances table and the "VM.Standard" shapes in the Compute - Virtual Machine Instances table are available in Oracle Database Cloud Service.

  • For instances on Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic:

    View a list of currently available shapes by going to the Pricing page for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Compute Classic - General Purpose Compute on cloud.oracle.com. The shapes in the General Purpose Shapes and the High Memory Shapes tables are available in Oracle Database Cloud Service.

Note: Not all shapes are available in all regions or sites.

vmPublicKeyText.description: Public key for the secure shell (SSH). This key will be used for authentication when connecting to the Database Cloud Service instance using an SSH client. You generate an SSH public-private key pair using a standard SSH key generation tool. See Connecting to a Compute Node Through Secure Shell (SSH) in Using Oracle Database Cloud Service.

subscriptionType.description:
Billing unit. Specify the value HOURLY or MONTHLY.

Note: The MONTHLY value is not available in accounts that use the Universal Credits payment model.

level.description:
Service level for the service instance. Specify the value PAAS.

Note: Some older accounts also support the value BASIC to denote the "Oracle Database Cloud Service - Virtual Image" service level.

version.description: Oracle Database software version; one of: 18.0.0.0, 12.2.0.1, 12.1.0.2, or 11.2.0.4.

edition.description:
Database edition for the service instance:

  • SE: Standard Edition

  • EE: Enterprise Edition

  • EE_HP: Enterprise Edition - High Performance

  • EE_EP: Enterprise Edition - Extreme Performance

If you specify SE, a Standard Edition 2 database is created if you specify 12.2.0.1 or 12.1.0.2 for version and a Standard Edition One database is created if you specify 11.2.0.4 for version.

Edition must be Enterprise Edition - Extreme Performance to configure the Database Cloud Service instance as Cluster Database.

region.description:
Applicable only to accounts that support regions.

Name of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure or Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

Note: When specifying an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region, the region must be in the default data region of the Cloud account.

availabilityDomain.description:
Required if region is an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region.

Name of the availability domain within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

subnet.description:
Required if region is an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure region.

The Oracle Cloud Identifier (OCID) of the subnet in the virtual cloud network (VCN) within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

The OCID is a unique autogenerated ID. To find the OCID of a subnet, go to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure web console, select the Networking tab, click the VCN that your subnet is in, and look for the OCID field under the subnet that you want to use.

ipNetwork.description:
Applicable only if region is an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic region.

The three-part name of a custom IP network to use. For example: /Compute-identity_domain/user/object.

A region must be specified in order to use ipNetwork. Only IP networks created in the specified region can be used.

You cannot use ipNetwork when creating a service instance that uses Oracle RAC and Oracle Data Guard to provide for disaster recovery. That is, when isRac, failoverDatabase and disasterRecovery are all set to "yes" in the parameters array element.

ipReservations.description:
Applicable only if region is an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic region.

A single IP reservation name or multiple IP reservation names separated by commas. Only IP reservations created in the specified region can be used.

When IP reservations are used, all compute nodes of an instance must be provisioned with IP reservations, so the number of names in ipReservations must match the number of compute nodes in the service instance.

useHighPerformanceStorage.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic regions.

Specify if high performance storage should be used for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default data storage will allocate your database block storage on spinning devices. By checking this box, your block storage will be allocated on solid state devices. Valid values are true and false. Default value is false.

isBYOL.description: Specify if you want to use an existing perpetual license to Oracle Database to establish the right to use Oracle Database on the new instance. When true, your Oracle Cloud account will be charged a lesser amount for the new instance because the right to use Oracle Database is covered by your perpetual license agreement. Valid values are true and false. Default value is false.

enableNotification.description:
Specify if you want an email notification sent upon successful or unsuccessful completion of the instance-creation operation. When true, you must also specify notificationEmail. Valid values are true and false. Default value is false.

This parameter is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

notificationEmail.description:
Required if enableNotification is set to true.

The email address to send completion notifications to.

This parameter is not available on Oracle Cloud at Customer.

standbys.title: standbys Array
standbys.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Array of one JSON object that specifies configuration details of the standby database when failoverDatabase is set to true. disasterRecovery must be set to true.

parameters.title: parameters Array
parameters.description: Array of one JSON object that specifies configuration details of the services instance. This array is not required if the level value is BASIC.

assignPublicIP.description:
Applicable only if region is an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic region and an ipNetwork value is provided.

Specify whether to assign public IP addresses to the compute nodes of the service instance:

  • When set to true, any compute node added during instance creation, or later added as part of a scaling operation, will have a public IP address assigned to it. Thus, all compute nodes will be accessible from the public Internet, provided that access rules permitting such access are enabled.

  • When set to false, any compute node added during instance creation, or later added as part of a scaling operation, will not have a public IP address assigned to it. Thus, no compute node will be accessible from the public Internet. Use this value in situations where the nodes and the database will only be accessed from within the IP network or from an on-premises data center over a VPN network.

Default value is true.

type.description:
Component type to which the set of parameters applies. Valid values are:
  • db - Oracle Database
    • .

usableStorage.description: Storage size for data (in GB). Minimum value is 15. Maximum value depends on the backup destination: if BOTH is specified, the maximum value is 1200; if OSS or NONE is specified, the maximum value is 2048.

adminPassword.description:
The password for the following administrative users:

  • Oracle Database administrative users sys and system
  • Oracle Application Express admin user
  • DBaaS Monitor user

The password:

  • Must be 8 to 30 characters in length.
  • Must contain at least one lowercase letter.
  • Must contain at least one uppercase letter.
  • Must contain at least one number.
  • Must contain at least one of these symbols: _ (underscore), # (hash sign), or $ (dollar sign).
  • Must not contain the word "oracle".

sid.description: Database Name (sid) for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is ORCL.

pdbName.description:
Note: This attribute is valid when Database Cloud Service instance is configured with version 12c.

Pluggable Database Name for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is pdb1.

timezone.description:
Time Zone for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is UTC.

Valid values are Africa/Cairo, Africa/Casablanca, Africa/Harare, Africa/Monrovia, Africa/Nairobi, Africa/Tripoli, Africa/Windhoek, America/Araguaina, America/Asuncion, America/Bogota, America/Caracas, America/Chihuahua, America/Cuiaba, America/Denver, America/Fortaleza, America/Guatemala, America/Halifax, America/Manaus, America/Matamoros, America/Monterrey, America/Montevideo, America/Phoenix, America/Santiago, America/Tijuana, Asia/Amman, Asia/Ashgabat, Asia/Baghdad, Asia/Baku, Asia/Bangkok, Asia/Beirut, Asia/Calcutta, Asia/Damascus, Asia/Dhaka, Asia/Irkutsk, Asia/Jerusalem, Asia/Kabul, Asia/Karachi, Asia/Kathmandu, Asia/Krasnoyarsk, Asia/Magadan, Asia/Muscat, Asia/Novosibirsk, Asia/Riyadh, Asia/Seoul, Asia/Shanghai, Asia/Singapore, Asia/Taipei, Asia/Tehran, Asia/Tokyo, Asia/Ulaanbaatar, Asia/Vladivostok, Asia/Yakutsk, Asia/Yerevan, Atlantic/Azores, Australia/Adelaide, Australia/Brisbane, Australia/Darwin, Australia/Hobart, Australia/Perth, Australia/Sydney, Brazil/East, Canada/Newfoundland, Canada/Saskatchewan, Europe/Amsterdam, Europe/Athens, Europe/Dublin, Europe/Helsinki, Europe/Istanbul, Europe/Kaliningrad, Europe/Moscow, Europe/Paris, Europe/Prague, Europe/Sarajevo, Pacific/Auckland, Pacific/Fiji, Pacific/Guam, Pacific/Honolulu, Pacific/Samoa, US/Alaska, US/Central, US/Eastern, US/East-Indiana, US/Pacific, UTC.

ncharset.description:
National Character Set for the Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is AL16UTF16.

Valid values are AL16UTF16 and UTF8.

charset.description:
Character Set for the Database Cloud Service Instance. Default value is AL32UTF8.

Valid values are AL32UTF8, AR8ADOS710, AR8ADOS720, AR8APTEC715, AR8ARABICMACS, AR8ASMO8X, AR8ISO8859P6, AR8MSWIN1256, AR8MUSSAD768, AR8NAFITHA711, AR8NAFITHA721, AR8SAKHR706, AR8SAKHR707, AZ8ISO8859P9E, BG8MSWIN, BG8PC437S, BLT8CP921, BLT8ISO8859P13, BLT8MSWIN1257, BLT8PC775, BN8BSCII, CDN8PC863, CEL8ISO8859P14, CL8ISO8859P5, CL8ISOIR111, CL8KOI8R, CL8KOI8U, CL8MACCYRILLICS, CL8MSWIN1251, EE8ISO8859P2, EE8MACCES, EE8MACCROATIANS, EE8MSWIN1250, EE8PC852, EL8DEC, EL8ISO8859P7, EL8MACGREEKS, EL8MSWIN1253, EL8PC437S, EL8PC851, EL8PC869, ET8MSWIN923, HU8ABMOD, HU8CWI2, IN8ISCII, IS8PC861, IW8ISO8859P8, IW8MACHEBREWS, IW8MSWIN1255, IW8PC1507, JA16EUC, JA16EUCTILDE, JA16SJIS, JA16SJISTILDE, JA16VMS, KO16KSC5601, KO16KSCCS, KO16MSWIN949, LA8ISO6937, LA8PASSPORT, LT8MSWIN921, LT8PC772, LT8PC774, LV8PC1117, LV8PC8LR, LV8RST104090, N8PC865, NE8ISO8859P10, NEE8ISO8859P4, RU8BESTA, RU8PC855, RU8PC866, SE8ISO8859P3, TH8MACTHAIS, TH8TISASCII, TR8DEC, TR8MACTURKISHS, TR8MSWIN1254, TR8PC857, US7ASCII, US8PC437, UTF8, VN8MSWIN1258, VN8VN3, WE8DEC, WE8DG, WE8ISO8859P1, WE8ISO8859P15, WE8ISO8859P9, WE8MACROMAN8S, WE8MSWIN1252, WE8NCR4970, WE8NEXTSTEP, WE8PC850, WE8PC858, WE8PC860, WE8ROMAN8, ZHS16CGB231280, ZHS16GBK, ZHT16BIG5, ZHT16CCDC, ZHT16DBT, ZHT16HKSCS, ZHT16MSWIN950, ZHT32EUC, ZHT32SOPS, ZHT32TRIS.

isRac.description: Specify if a cluster database using Oracle Real Application Clusters should be configured. Valid values are yes and no. Default value is no.

failoverDatabase.description: Specify if an Oracle Data Guard configuration comprising a primary database and a standby database is created. Valid values are yes and no. Default value is no.

disasterRecovery.description:
Specify if an Oracle Data Guard configuration is created using the Disaster Recovery option or the High Availability option. Valid values are yes and no:

  • yes - The Disaster Recovery option is used, which places the compute node hosting the primary database and the compute node hosting the standby database in compute zones of different data centers.

  • no - The High Availability option is used, which places the compute node hosting the primary database and the compute node hosting the standby database in different compute zones of the same data center.

Default value is no.

This option is applicable only when failoverDatabase is set to yes.

goldenGate.description:
Specify if the database should be configured for use as the replication database of an Oracle GoldenGate Cloud Service instance. Valid values are yes and no. Default value is no.

You cannot set goldenGate to yes if either isRac or failoverDatabase is set to yes.

backupDestination.description:
Backup destination. Valid values are:
  • BOTH - Both Cloud Storage and Local Storage
  • OSS - Cloud Storage only
  • NONE - None

cloudStorageContainer.description:
The location where backups to cloud storage are to be stored:

  • For service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, enter the URL of an existing Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage bucket. The URL is of the form:

    https://swiftobjectstorage.region.oraclecloud.com/v1/account/bucket

    For example:

    https://swiftobjectstorage.us-phoenix-1.oraclecloud.com/v1/mycompany/mybucket

    You must create this storage bucket before you begin creating the service instace. See Object Storage API in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure documentation.

  • For database deployments in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, enter the location of an Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic container using this form:

    Storage-identity_domain/container

    where identity_domain is the id of the identity domain, and container is the name of the container.

    Note: In some Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic accounts, you cannot use the above form. If you get an error when you try to use this form, you must instead provide a full URL for the container using this form:

    rest-endpoint-url/container

    To determine the rest-endpoint-url value for your account, see About REST URLs for Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic Resources in Using Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic.

cloudStorageUser.description:
A user with read/write (and creation, if necessary) access to the location specified in cloudStorageContainer:

  • For service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, enter the user name you use to sign in to the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure console.

  • For service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, enter the Oracle Cloud user name of the administrator of the Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic container specified in cloudStorageContainer. Usually, this is your Oracle Cloud user name.

cloudStoragePwd.description:
The password necessary to access the location specified in cloudStorageContainer:

  • For service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure, enter your Swift password.

  • For service instances in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic, enter the password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in cloudStorageUser.

createStorageContainerIfMissing.description:
Applicable only to Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Object Storage Classic containers.

Specify if the given cloudStorageContainer is to be created if it does not already exist. Valid values are true and false. Default value is false.

listenerPort.description: The port number for the Oracle Net Listener. The port number must be between 1521 and 5499 (inclusive). Default value is 1521.

sourceServiceName.description: When present, indicates that the service instance should be created as a "snapshot clone" of another service instance. Provide the name of the existing service instance whose snapshot is to be used.

snapshotName.description: The name of the snapshot of the service instance specified by sourceServiceName that is to be used to create a "snapshot clone". This parameter is valid only if sourceServiceName is specified.

ibkup.description: Specify if the service instance's database should, after the instance is created, be replaced by a database stored in an existing cloud backup that was created using Oracle Database Backup Cloud Service. Valid values are yes and no. Default value is no.

ibkupOnPremise.description: Specify if the existing cloud backup being used to replace the database is from an on-premises database or another Database Cloud Service instance. Valid values are true for an on-premises database and false for a Database Cloud Service instance. Default value is true.

ibkupDatabaseID.description: Database id of the database from which the existing cloud backup was created. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupDecryptionKey.description: Password used to create the existing, password-encrypted cloud backup. This password is used to decrypt the backup. Specify either ibkupDecryptionKey or ibkupWalletFileContent for decrypting the backup. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupWalletFileContent.description: String containing the xsd:base64Binary representation of the cloud backup's wallet file. This wallet is used to decrypt the backup. Specify either ibkupDecryptionKey or ibkupWalletFileContent for decrypting the backup. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupCloudStorageContainer.description: Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the existing cloud backup is stored. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupCloudStorageUser.description: User name of an Oracle Cloud user who has read access to the container specified in ibkupCloudStorageContainer. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupCloudStoragePassword.description: Password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in ibkupCloudStorageUser. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to yes.

ibkupServiceID.description: Oracle Databsae Cloud Service instance name from which the database of new Oracle Database Cloud Service instance should be created. This parameter is required if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to no.

ibkupBackupTAG.description: Backup tag of the specific backup from which the database of new Oracle Database Cloud Service instance should be created. This parameter is valid only if ibkup is set to yes and ibkupOnPremise is set to no. If no value is specified, the latest backup is used.

hdg.description:
Specify if an Oracle Hybrid Disaster Recovery configuration comprising a primary database on customer premisesand a standby database in Oracle Public Cloud should be configured. Valid values are yes and no. Default value is no.

You cannot set failoverDatabase or isRac to yes if Hybrid Disaster Recovery options is chosen.

hdgCloudStorageContainer.description: Name of the Oracle Storage Cloud Service container where the backup from on-premise instance is stored. This parameter is required if hdg is set to yes.

hdgCloudStorageUser.description: User name of an Oracle Cloud user who has read access to the container specified in hdgCloudStorageContainer. This parameter is required if hdg is set to yes.

hdgCloudStoragePassword.description: Password of the Oracle Cloud user specified in hdgCloudStorageUser. This parameter is required if hdg is set to yes.

db_demo.description: Indicates whether to include the Demos PDB: "yes" or "no".

availabilityDomain.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the availability domain within the region where the standby database of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

subnet.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the subnet within the region where the standby database of the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is to be provisioned.

uri.description: REST endpoint URI for Database Cloud Service in the identity domain.

service_type.description: The value dbaas to denote Database Cloud Service.

services.title: services Array
services.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each service instance in the identity domain.

backup_supported_version.description: The version of cloud tooling for backup and recovery supported by the service instance.

created_by.description: The user name of the Oracle Cloud user who created the service instance.

creation_time.description: The date-and-time stamp when the service instance was created.

description.description: The description of the service instance, if one was provided when the instance was created.

identity_domain.description: The identity domain housing the service instance.

last_modified_time.description: The date-and-time stamp when the service instance was last modified.

service_name.description: The name of the service instance.

service_uri.description: The REST endpoint URI of the service instance.

sm_plugin_version.description: The version of the cloud tooling service manager plugin supported by the service instance.

status.description:
The status of the service instance:
  • Configured: the service instance has been configured.
  • In Progress: the service instance is being created.
  • Maintenance: the service instance is being stopped, started, restarted or scaled.
  • Running: the service instance is running.
  • Stopped: the service instance is stopped.
  • Terminating: the service instance is being deleted.

version.description: The Oracle Database version on the service instance.

apex_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Oracle Application Express on the service instance.

availabilityDomain.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the availability domain within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is provisioned.

backup_destination.description: The backup configuration of the service instance.

backup_supported_version.description: The version of cloud tooling for backup and recovery supported by the service instance.

charset.description: The database character set of the database.

cloud_storage_container.description: The Oracle Storage Cloud container for backups.

compute_site_name.description: The Oracle Cloud location housing the service instance.

connect_descriptor.description: The connection descriptor for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net).

connect_descriptor_with_public_ip.description: The connection descriptor for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net) with IP addresses instead of host names.

created_by.description: The user name of the Oracle Cloud user who created the service instance.

creation_job_id.description: The job id of the job that created the service instance.

creation_time.description: The date-and-time stamp when the service instance was created.

current_version.description: The Oracle Database version on the service instance, including the patch level.

dbaasmonitor_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Oracle DBaaS Monitor on the service instance.

description.description: The description of the service instance, if one was provided when the instance was created.

edition.description: The software edition of the service instance.

em_url.description: The URL to use to connect to Enterprise Manager on the service instance.

failover_database.description: Indicates whether the service instance hosts an Oracle Data Guard configuration.

glassfish_url.description: The URL to use to connect to the Oracle GlassFish Server Administration Console on the service instance.

hdgPremIP.description: Data Guard Role of the on-premise instance in Oracle Hybrid Disaster Recovery configuration.

hybrid_dg.description: Indicates whether the service instance hosts an Oracle Hybrid Disaster Recovery configuration.

identity_domain.description: The identity domain housing the service instance.

ipNetwork.description: This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. The three-part name of an IP network to which the service instance is added. For example: /Compute-identity_domain/user/object

ipReservations.description: Groups one or more IP reservations in use on this service instance. This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. This attribute is returned when you set the ?outputLevel=verbose query parameter.

isBYOL.description: Indicates whether service instance was provisioned with the 'Bring Your Own License' (BYOL) option.

jaas_instances_using_service.description: The Oracle Java Cloud Service instances using this Database Cloud Service instance.

last_modified_time.description: The date-and-time stamp when the service instance was last modified.

level.description:
The service level of the service instance:
  • BASIC: The Oracle Database Cloud Service - Virtual Image service level
  • PAAS:The Oracle Database Cloud Service service level

listenerPort.description: The listener port for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net) connections.

ncharset.description: The national character set of the database.

num_ip_reservations.description: The number of Oracle Compute Service IP reservations assigned to the service instance.

num_nodes.description: The number of compute nodes in the service instance.

pdbName.description: The name of the default PDB (pluggable database) created when the service instance was created.

rac_database.description: Indicates whether the service instance hosts an Oracle RAC database.

region.description: This attribute is only applicable to accounts where regions are supported. Location where the service instance is provisioned (only for accounts where regions are supported).

service_name.description: The name of the service instance.

service_uri.description: The REST endpoint URI of the service instance.

shape.description: The Oracle Compute Cloud shape of the service instance.

sm_plugin_version.description: The version of the cloud tooling service manager plugin supported by the service instance.

status.description:
The status of the service instance:
  • Configured: the service instance has been configured.
  • In Progress: the service instance is being created.
  • Maintenance: the service instance is being stopped, started, restarted or scaled.
  • Running: the service instance is running.
  • Stopped: the service instance is stopped.
  • Terminating: the service instance is being deleted.

subnet.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the subnet within the region where the Oracle Database Cloud Service instance is provisioned.

subscriptionType.description: The billing frequency of the service instance; either MONTHLY or HOURLY.

timezone.description: The time zone of the operating system.

total_shared_storage.description: For service instances hosting an Oracle RAC database, the size in MB of the storage shared and accessed by the nodes of the RAC database.

useHighPerformanceStorage.description: Indicates whether the service instance was provisioned with high performance storage.

version.description: The Oracle Database version on the service instance.

view-instance-nodes.title: Response Body
view-instance-nodes.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each of the service instance's compute nodes.

availabilityDomain.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the availability domain within the region where the compute node is provisioned.

connect_descriptor.description: The connection descriptor for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net).

connect_descriptor_with_public_ip.description: The connection descriptor for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net) with IP addresses instead of host names.

created_by.description: The user name of the Oracle Cloud user who created the service instance.

creation_job_id.description: The job id of the job that created the service instance.

creation_time.description: The date-and-time stamp when the service instance was created.

hostname.description: The host name of the compute node.

initialPrimary.description: Indicates whether the compute node hosted the primary database of an Oracle Data Guard configuration when the service instance was created.

listenerPort.description: The listener port for Oracle Net Services (SQL*Net) connections.

pdbName.description: The name of the default PDB (pluggable database) created when the service instance was created.

reservedIP.description: The IP address of the compute node.

shape.description: The Oracle Compute Cloud shape of the compute node.

sid.description: The SID of the database on the compute node.

status.description:
The status of the compute node:
  • Configured: the compute node has been configured.
  • In Progress: the compute node is being created.
  • Maintenance: the compute node is being stopped, started, restarted or scaled.
  • Running: the compute node is running.
  • Stopped: the compute node is stopped.
  • Terminating: the compute node is being deleted.

storageAllocated.description: The size in MB of the storage allocated to the compute node. For compute nodes of a service instance hosting an Oracle RAC database, this number does not include the storage shared by the nodes.

subnet.description:
Applicable only in Oracle Cloud Infrastructure regions.

Name of the subnet within the region where the compute node is provisioned.

lifecycleState.description:
Type of the request. Valid values are:
  • stop: Stops the Database Cloud Service instance or compute node.
  • start: Starts the Database Cloud Service instance or compute node.
  • restart: Restarts the Database Cloud Service instance or compute node.

lifecycleTimeout.description: Timeout (minutes) for each request. The range of valid values are 1 to 300 minutes (inclusive). This value defaults to 60 minutes.

vmName.description: Name of compute node to stop, start, or restart.

shape.description: Specify new shape for the Database Cloud Service instance. User can specify a higher shape (Scale Up) or a lower shape (Scale Down). Shape is optional. User can add storage only without changing shape.

additionalStorage.description: Specify size of additional storage in Giga Bytes. This parameter is optional. User can change shape only without adding storage. If additionalStorage is specified, minimum value is 1GB and maximum value is 1TB.

componentInstanceName.description:
(Applies only to service instances that use Oracle RAC and Oracle Data Guard together.)

Specifies whether the scaling operation applies to the primary database or standby database of the Data Guard configuration. Specify the value DB_1 for the primary database or the value DB_2 for the standby database.

usage.description: This parameter specifies usage of additional storage and is applicable only when additionalStorage is specified. Specify usage to extend Data or Backup storage volumes of Database Cloud Service instance. Valid values are data to extend Data Storage Volume and fra to extend Backup Storage Volume. If usage is not specified, new storage volume will be created.

action.description: The role-change action to be performed on the Database Cloud Service instance hosting an Oracle Data Guard configuration. Valid values: switchover, failover, reinstate.

force.description:
Optional parameter only when the failover action is specified. Valid values: yes and no. Default value is no.

In general, You should use the deafult value of no. However, if a failover operation fails and you review the messages describing the cause of the failure, you might choose to try the failover operation again with the force parameter set to yes. Note that forcing a failover operation can result in potential data loss.

service_name.description: The name of the service instance.

version.description: The Oracle Database software version in use.

status.description:
The instance status; one of: Running, In Progress, Maintenance, Stopped, Terminating,

  • Configured
    • , Failed.

identity_domain.description: The identity domain hosting the instance.

creation_time.description: The instance creation date and time.

last_modified_time.description: The date and time of last modification.

created_by.description: The name of the Oracle Cloud user who created the instance.

service-uri.description: The resource URL for the instance.

message.description: Array of strings that contain details of operation progress.

job_start_date.description: The date and time when the job started.

job_status.description: Current status of the job; one of: In Progress, Succeded, Failed.

job_operation.description: Current operation name in the job.

jobstatus-response-message-array-item.title: message Array Item
jobstatus-response-message-array-item.description: String containing one operation progress message.

tenant.description: The identity domain hosting the service instance.

serviceInstance.description: The name of the service instance.

serviceVersion.description: The Oracle Database software version in use.

service-vm-name.description: The name of the service instance's compute node.

lifecycleState.description: The name of the life-cycle state change for operations that change the life-cycle state.

hasMore.description: Indicates whether more keys are available to be requested, with the value true indicating that more are available.

items.title: items Array
items.description: Array of JSON objects, with one element for each key returned.

totalResults.description: Number of keys returned by this request.

computeKeyName.description: The fully qualified name of the SSH Key object in Oracle Compute Cloud Service where the SSH public key value is stored.

identityDomain.description: The name of the identity domain for the Database Cloud Service account.

lastUpdateMessage.description: The message returned from the last update of the SSH key. For example: newly created, updated by username.

lastUpdateStatus.description: Status of the last update of the SSH key.

lastUpdateTime.description: Date and time of the last update of the SSH key.

publicKey.description: The value of the SSH public key, with any slashes (/) it contains preceded by backslashes, as in \/.

serviceName.description: The name of the Database Cloud Service instance.

serviceState.description: The status of the service instance. For example, RUNNING.

lastUpdateTime.description: Date and time of the last update of the SSH key.

public-key.description: The value of the SSH public key, with any slashes (/) it contains preceded by backslashes, as in \/.

status.description: Status description. For example: submitted job.

authDomain.description:
Identity domain ID for the Database Cloud Service account:
 

  • For a Cloud account with Identity Cloud Service: the identity service ID, which has the form idcs-letters-and-numbers. You can find this ID in the Identity Service Id field on the Overview tab of the Service Details page for Database Cloud Service in My Services.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

authUser.description: Name of the Oracle Cloud user that initiated the add operation.

endDate.description: Date and time the job ended.

identityDomain.description:
Identity domain ID for the Database Cloud Service account:
 

  • For a Cloud account with Identity Cloud Service: the identity service ID, which has the form idcs-letters-and-numbers. You can find this ID in the Identity Service Id field on the Overview tab of the Service Details page for Database Cloud Service in My Services.

  • For a traditional cloud account: the name of the identity domain.

jobId.description: Job ID returned in the Location header when the Add SSH Key request was made.

messages.title: messages Array
messages.description: Array of JSON objects, with one element for each message reported during the job.

serviceId.description: ID of the Database Cloud Service instance.

serviceName.description: Name of the Database Cloud Service instance.

startDate.description: Date and time the job started.

status.description: Status of the job. Valid statuses include RUNNING, SUCCEED and FAILED.

activityDate.description: Date and time the activity was logged.

available-patches-response.description: The response body contains information about the available patches.

availablePatchGuiMetadata.description: Instruction to the metadata UI about the patch.

supportsPreCheck.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch supports precheck via UI.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Upgrade, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchSeverity.description: Severity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

includesConfigUpgrade.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch includes a configuration upgrade.

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

serviceVersion.description: Oracle Database Cloud Service instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 11.2.0.4, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

releaseDate.description: Date and time the patch is released.

entryDate.description: Date and time the patch is created.

entryUserId.description: Name of the user that created the patch.

componentPatches.description: Group the details of each patches in the component.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

requiresRestart.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch requires a restart of the service instance.

serviceTypeVersions.description: Oracle Database Cloud Service instance version to which the patch can be applied. For example: 11.2.0.7, Any, where Any indicates that the patch can be applied to any version.

isDeleted.description: Flag that indicates whether the patch has been deleted and is no longer available. The information about the patch is not removed from the list of available patches in order to maintain an historical record of all patches.

metaVersion.description: The release version of metadata service manager.

supportedStrategy.description: Supported patching strategy. For example: In Place.

releaseVersion.description: Release version of the component in this patch.

component-patch.description: Group the details of each patch in the component.

releaseVersion.description: Release version of the component in this patch.

displayName.description: Display name of the component in this patch.

zipBundles.description: Zips that contain the patched binaries or patches.

preserveFiles.description: List of files to be preserved during patching.

patch-component.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

component.description: Name of the component in this patch db.

md5sum.description: Checksum used to validate the patch binary.

provisioningObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when creating a new service instance.

patchingObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when patching a service instance.

preserveFiles.description: List of files to be preserved during patching.

view-zip-bundles.description: Group the details of zips for the patched binaries.

md5sum.description: Checksum used to validate the patch binary.

provisioningObjectRef.description: Location of binary to use when creating a new service instance.

storageKey.description: Location of the patch zip on the cloud.

zipVersion.description: Software version that is included in the zip.

releaseUrl.description: URL for more information about this release.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patching operation.

forceApply.description:
Specifies whether the patch should be applied even if precheck finds conflicts. When true, patch conflicts or errors discovered during the precheck stage of the patching operation are ignored and the patch will be applied (space permitting). Otherwise, if conflicts or errors are discovered, the patch will not be applied.

Default value is false.

switchOver.description:
(Applicable only to service instances hosting a Data Guard configuration.)

Specifies whether a switchover operation is performed on the primary database before applying a patch. Valid values are true and false.

Default value is false.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the precheck operation.
Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback operation.

switchOver.description:
(Applicable only to service instances hosting a Data Guard configuration.)

Specifies whether a switchover operation is performed on the primary database before rolling back the patch. Valid values are true and false.

Default value is false.

status.description: Status of the request to start a job for the operation. Usually the value Completed.

jobId.description: Job ID of the job that was started to perform the operation.

applied-patches-response.description: The response body includes details of all applied patches.

backupStatus.description: Whether a backup of the software was created before the patch was applied. Valid values include: Available, SameVersion, Unavailable, Unknown.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

appliedDate.description: Date and time that the patch was applied.

patchReleaseUrl.description: URL that provides more information about the patch.

releaseDate.description: Date and time patch was released.

lastStatus.description: Status of the patch operation. For example: IN PROGRESS, COMPLETED, and FAILED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

lastStatusMessage.description: Last message logged for the patch operation.

componentPatches.description: Group the details of each patches in the component.

patchComponents.description: Group the details of the patch to be applied.

patchCategory.description: Category of the patch. For example: General, Multiple, Security, and so on.

patchSeverity.description: Severity of the patch. For example Normal, Mandatory, Recommended, and so on.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

toVersion.description: Version of Oracle Database Cloud Service instance that was patched.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the backup.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch is still in progress.

operationType.description: Patch operating being performed. Valid values include: Rollback, Patching, and None.

id.description: Unique ID of the patching operation. Use this ID to get details of a patching operation.

rollbackId.description: ID of the rollback that is associated to the completed patching operation. The ID is used to rollback a patch operation.

rollbackVersion.description: Version to which the patched component will be rolled back.

currentPatchLevel.description: Current patch level for the component.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

patching-result.description: Groups information about the results of the patch.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

patchingId.description: ID of the applied patch operation.

backupId.description: Backup ID. You can use the backup ID to manage the backup.

versionBeforeThisPatch.description: Version of the component before the patch was applied.

strategy.description: Patching strategy. For example, Rolling. To minimize service disruption, the patch is applied in a rolling pattern, patching a single node at a time.

metaVersionBeforeThisPatch.description: Version of the metadata service manager before the patch was applied.

customRollbackId.description: ID to be used in a rollback operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the patch operation started.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the patching operation. For example, COMPLETED. COMPLETED_ROLLBACK is displayed when an applied patch has been rolled back.

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the patching operation.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the patch.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that applied the patch. system displays if the patch was applied by an auto-update scheduled job.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patch operation.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the patch operations.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the patch.

rollback-result.description: Groups information about the results of the rollback operation. This attribute displays only when a rollback of the patch had been performed.

startDate.description: Date and time that the rollback operation started.

patchingStatus.description: Status of the rollback operation. For example, COMPLETED_ROLLBACK.

resultMessage.description: System message that describes the rollback operation.

additionalNote.description: Free-form text to provide additional information about the rollback.

appliedBy.description: Name of the user that performed the rollback.

jobId.description: Job ID for the rollback operation.

completeLog.description: System messages that track the rollback operations.

progressMessages.description: List of progress messages for the rollback.

view-precheck-response.description: The response body includes information about the patch precheck. When viewing all patching prechecks, the response body includes information about all patch prechecks executed on this service instance.

jobId.description: Job ID for the patching precheck operation.

startDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation started.

endDate.description: Date and time that the patching precheck operation stopped.

performedBy.description: Name of the user account used to perform the patch precheck.

inProgress.description: Flag that specifies whether the patch precheck is still in progress.

status.description:
Status of the patching precheck operation. Valid values include:
  • PASSED_PRECHECK - Patching precheck passed.
  • DIDNT_PASS_PRECHECK - Patching precheck did not pass. Check the preCheckMessages attribute for more information.
  • DIDNT_FINISHED_PRECHECK - An internal error was encountered and the patching precheck could not be performed.

href.description: URL for checking the status of the patching precheck job. This attribute displays only when viewing all patching precheck operations.

jsonResult.description: System messages. This attribute displays only when viewing the status of one patching precheck operation.

statusMessage.description: Describes status of executed precheck. Describes if the operation completed or encountered any errors.

messages.description: Precheck status detailed messages, if any.

backupList.title: backupList Array
backupList.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each backup operation.

backupCompletedDate.description: The date-and-time stamp when the backup operation completed. Applies to completed backups only.

backupStartDate.description: The date-and-time stamp when the backup operation started. Applies to in-progress and failed backups only.

dbTag.description: Tag that uniquely identifies the backup. Applies to completed backups only.

status.description: Status of the backup; one of IN PROGRESS, FAILED, or COMPLETED. Note that there is only one in-progress backup at any given time, and that only the last failed backup is listed.

keepForever.description: Boolean indicating if this backup is a long term backup.

recoveryList.title: recoveryList Array
recoveryList.description: Array of JSON object elements, with one element for each recovery operation.

dbTag.description: Database Tag used if the recovery was performed using a tag.

latest.description: True if the recovery was performed to the latest available backup.

recoveryCompleteDate.description: The date-and-time stamp when the recovery operation completed. Applies to completed recovery operations only.

recoveryStartDate.description: The date-and-time stamp when the recovery operation started. Applies to in-progress and failed recovery operations only.

scn.description: SCN (System Change Number) used if the recovery was performed using an SCN.

status.description: Status of the recovery operation; one of IN PROGRESS, FAILED, or COMPLETED.

timestamp.description: Timestamp used if the recovery was performed using a timestamp.

keepForever.description: Specify for long term backup. Valid values are true or false. Default is false.

latest.description: Recover using the latest available backup.

scn.description: Recover using a System Change Number.

timestamp.description: Recover using a timestamp. The timestamp must be UTC and of the format dd-MMM-yyyy HH:mm:ss.

keepForever.description: Specify whether the backup being recovered is a long term, or "keep forever", backup. Valid values are true or false. Default is false.

tags.name: IP Reservations
tags.description:
REST endpoints to create, view and delete IP reservations for Database Cloud Service instances.

These endpoints are available only in Cloud accounts that support Oracle Cloud Infrastructure Classic regions.

tags.name: Access Rules
tags.description: View and manage the Oracle Compute Cloud Service security rules for Database Cloud Service instances.

tags.name: Backup and Recovery
tags.description: REST endpoints to manage backup and recovery operations on Database Cloud Service instances.

tags.name: Patches
tags.description: REST endpoints to precheck, apply and roll back patches on Database Cloud Service instances.

tags.name: SSH Keys
tags.description: View and manage secure shell (SSH) public keys for Database Cloud Service instances.

tags.name: Service Instances
tags.description: REST endpoints to create and manage Database Cloud Service instances.

tags.name: Snapshots
tags.description: REST endpoints to create, view and delete storage snapshots of Database Cloud Service instances.
